Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

nodes.body: :v: jcommelin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Build failed (retrying...):
  * Build

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7816056838/job/21320761266)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7816056838/job/21320760485)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7816056838/job/21320760972)

A few small nitpicks but LGTM.

Thanks!

bors d+

I appreciate that this is a `private` "auxiliary" lemma but I was quite confused by the redundant hypothesis, and to a lesser extent, by the fact that it takes its name from the result it is ultimately supporting. I suggest:
```suggestion
lemma exists_eval_ne_zero_of_coeff_finSuccEquiv_ne_zero_aux
    {N : ℕ} {F : MvPolynomial (Fin (N + 1)) R} {n : ℕ} (hF : IsHomogeneous F n)
    (hFn : (finSuccEquiv R N F).coeff n ≠ 0) :
    ∃ r, eval r F ≠ 0 := by
  have hF₀ : F ≠ 0 := by contrapose! hFn; simp [hFn]
  have hdeg : natDegree (finSuccEquiv R N F) < n + 1 := by
    linarith [natDegree_finSuccEquiv F, degreeOf_le_totalDegree F 0, hF.totalDegree hF₀]
```
I recognise that this means that the logic to establish `hdeg` appears both here and in its application below but I claim what I propose is the lesser of these two evils.

When possible I think it's helpful if a section name aligns with a `variable` type.
```suggestion
section IsDomain
```

```suggestion
lemma funext [Infinite R] (hF : F.IsHomogeneous n) (hF₀ : ∀ r : σ → R, eval r F = 0) : F = 0 := by
```
I prefer shadowing the existing variable `F`, because now the `Infinite R` will come earlier in the list of hyps.
Fair enough.

I think we should probably reserve the name `funext` for a lemma stating `F = G`. How about:
```suggestion
/-- See `MvPolynomial.IsHomogeneous.eq_zero_of_forall_eval_eq_zero` for a version that assumes
`Infinite R`. -/
lemma eq_zero_of_forall_eval_eq_zero_of_le_card
    (hF : F.IsHomogeneous n) (hF₀ : ∀ r : σ → R, eval r F = 0) (h : n ≤ #R) :
```
For that matter, it would be nice if we had:
```lean
@[ext]
lemma funext {G : MvPolynomial σ R} [Infinite R]
    (hF : F.IsHomogeneous n) (hG : G.IsHomogeneous n)
    (h : ∀ r, eval r F = eval r G) : F = G := by
  sorry
```
but this is not necessary (and I'm not 100% about that `@[ext]` attribute --- I always test them before I commit).

We already have the `ext` for "coefficient-wise equality". And I think that one should be the default.

But yes, I will add this lemmas.

I see, with this in mind and the new additions, these lemmas look great now. I did wonder if we need the `F = 0` variants since we have the `F = G` versions but I can imagine these being quite useful for rewriting.
I wonder if we should actually state and prove the contrapositive of this lemma too (and above): it gets fed straight into a `contrapose!` after all.
I'm not sure what exactly you suggest...

My words are a bit sloppy. What I mean is that the current proposal is to have both `exists_eval_ne_zero_of_totalDegree_le_card` and its contrapositive `eq_zero_of_forall_eval_eq_zero_of_le_card` which seems redundant.

So the minimum I am suggesting is to drop `exists_eval_ne_zero_of_totalDegree_le_card` entirely (inlining its proof within `eq_zero_of_forall_eval_eq_zero_of_le_card`) and the maximum (which is probably not worth it since they are `private` "auxiliary" lemmas) would be to bubble this pattern up to `exists_eval_ne_zero_of_totalDegree_le_card_aux` and `exists_eval_ne_zero_of_coeff_finSuccEquiv_ne_zero_aux` also.

The suggestion would leave us with:
```lean
/-- See `MvPolynomial.IsHomogeneous.eq_zero_of_forall_eval_eq_zero`
for a version that assumes `Infinite R`. -/
lemma eq_zero_of_forall_eval_eq_zero_of_le_card
    (hF : F.IsHomogeneous n) (hF₀ : ∀ r : σ → R, eval r F = 0) (hnR : n ≤ #R) :
    F = 0 := by
  contrapose! hF₀
  obtain ⟨k, f, hf, F, rfl⟩ := exists_fin_rename F
  have hF₀ : F ≠ 0 := by rintro rfl; simp at hF₀
  have hF : F.IsHomogeneous n := by rwa [rename_isHomogeneous_iff hf] at hF
  obtain ⟨r, hr⟩ := exists_eval_ne_zero_of_totalDegree_le_card_aux hF hF₀ hnR
  obtain ⟨r, rfl⟩ := (Function.factorsThrough_iff _).mp <| (hf.factorsThrough r)
  use r
  rwa [eval_rename]
```
and no `exists_eval_ne_zero_of_totalDegree_le_card` lemma.
Got it. Done.

This is already opened (for the entire section) on line 295.
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```
